metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5842 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The html_context_handle_element function in gst/subparse/samiparse.c in gst-plugins-base in GStreamer before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) via a crafted SMI file, as demonstrated by OneNote_Manager.smi.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-base-1.0 - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-alsa - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base-apps - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-x - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
libgstreamer-plugins-base1.0-0 - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-base1.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2').
